docs.lead_paragraph: The costs of replacing hip or knee implants that fail are largely paid by Medicare, insurers and patients, not the orthopedics industry.

headline.seo: Makers of Artificial Joints Rarely Offer Warranties
headline.main: Health System Bears Cost of Implants With No Warranties

docs.snippet: The costs of replacing hip or knee implants that fail are largely paid by Medicare, insurers and patients, not the orthopedics industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge said the plaintiffs lacked standing to sue under the Unfair Competition Law but did not rule on the merits of their allegations.

docs.lead_paragraph: By 2014, private insurers will be required to accept all applicants without varying premiums on account of a person’s health.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida doctor affixed a note to his door saying that supporters of President Obama should seek medical help elsewhere.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Room for Debate forum last week discussed the effectiveness of public campaigns to promote healthy eating and reduce obesity. Many readers wrote in about their own struggles with weight, what worked for them and how public policy might be changed to help Americans keep the pounds off. Here are excerpts from their comments.

headline.main: What It Takes to Fight Obesity

docs.abstract: Room for Debate readers on their struggles with weight and ways to keep the pounds off.
docs.snippet: Room for Debate readers on their struggles with weight and ways to keep the pounds off.

docs.lead_paragraph: Your Jokes | Use the comment link below. One joke per comment, please:
docs.abstract: Your Jokes | So the deal is, we buy health insurance or pay a fine or go to jail, where health care is free. That must be your public option right there. -- Will Durst, San Francisco
docs.snippet: Your Jokes | So the deal is, we buy health insurance or pay a fine or go to jail, where health care is free. That must be your public option right there. -- Will Durst, San Francisco

docs.lead_paragraph: Today's Patient Money column offers a useful primer of the various health insurance options available to people who have recently lost their jobs or who don't have insurance.

headline.main: Answers for the Unemployed and Uninsured

docs.lead_paragraph: In one of the first steps toward implementing the recently adopted health care legislation, the secretary of health and human services, Kathleen Sebelius, on Friday sent a letter to governors and state insurance commissioners asking whether they were interested in creating high-risk insurance pools.

headline.main: Sebelius Begins Push for High-Risk Pools

docs.abstract: The secretary of health and human services moves to implement a provision of the new health care legislation.
docs.snippet: The secretary of health and human services moves to implement a provision of the new health care legislation.
